review_blob: Black, beige head. Fruity aroma, licorice, not much roasted character. Licorice in the flavor, very thin body. Watery, not at all what I want in a stout.

Dark red colour, white dissipating head. Was expecting something IPA-like, but the aroma is more caramel-like, or dark fruit. Hint of apricot. Medium body, slightly bitter aftertaste, lovely warmth from the alcohol. Great balance.

Light blond, white foam, large bubbles, not very stable. Grassy, hoppy aroma, spicy. Nice mouthfeel, not a bad taste. Good drinkable beer, but not familiar enough with the style to judge it on that. The Columbus hops are pretty powerful, and hardly typical.
Cloudy, decent quite stable foam. The aroma is wonderful. Nice bitter beer, surprisingly full body for such a low alcohol percentage (not very full at all, but still)
Pours nice black colour, light brown foam. Sounds fizzy, but not much fizziness in the palate. Foam vanishes quickly. Coffee in the aroma, hints of fruit. More of the same in the taste, decent stout.
Amber or orange, head disappears quickly. Smokey aroma, a hint of citrus. Smoke in the flavor as well. Slightly bitter, doesn't hang very long. Ok, but not what I look for in an IPA.
beer_name: Emelisse Innovation Serie: Smoked Rye IPA

review_blob: Black, beige head, good lacing. Smells like whiskey, touch of smoke, coffee. Mouthfeel is great, full. A bit of smoke, licorice, coffee, lovely flavor. Bitterness in the aftertaste, flavors stay for a while, bitterness much longer.
Orange colour, nice beige head. Hoppy aroma, citrus, orange peel. Orange hints in the flavor as well, quite bitter and dry. Lovely.
Golden with white foam. Yeasty aroma, fruity. Peach, apricot. Medium body. Quite a bit of alcohol in the nose and mouthfeel.
Dark color, decent beige foam. Surprising sour, oud bruin-ish aroma, probably the oaky touch. Red fruit, malty undertones. Roasted, woody flavours, hint of chocolate. Medium body.
Burnt with some sour undertones. Caramel, coffee. Pitch black with dark head. Medium to full body, lovely liquorice taste.
Light blond, bubbly head, moderately stable. Yeasty aroma, hints of hops. Quite bitter taste, some spices coming through. Quite full body, oily texture. Leaves a long lasting bitter aftertaste.
Light, clear golden colour, stable white head. Fruity aroma, apricot, hint of malt. Bitterness, hanging in the aftertaste. Medium body.

Love the smell of this one, a nice mixture of light, citrusy tones balanced on a heavy, malty, roasted chocolaty base. Dark red, seems pretty clear but hard to tell. Nice lacing, decent foam, quite stable. Moderately bitter taste, really comes though in the aftertaste. Fairly full bodied.
Gold colour, off white foam. Beautiful hoppy aroma, yeasty fruitiness. Spices in the taste, plenty of fruitiness with hoppy bitterness in the aftertaste.

Citrusy, hoppy aroma. Fruity yeast aromas come through as it gets warmer, and especially to the end of the bottle. Clear golden colour. Frothy white head. Bitter taste, think its dry hopped. Soft carbonation, full body. Bitter aftertaste, not too strong, lingers. They call it a summer ale, and its definitely refreshing. A pleasant surprise.
Fresh, strong citrusy hop aroma. Amber with strong tan head. Bitter, especially in the aftertaste. Medium body, soft carbonation. A fuller body would make this a winner for me.
